instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> motherboard compatibility
threads.message:
Hi Guys,

sorry if its an off-topic but i cant seem to find online whether <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 motherboard is compatible with 2017 model?
There is no better place on Earth to ask this question ;)

Thanks!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> motherboard compatibility
threads.message: They should be cross compatible, however the 2017 uses a slightly faster GPU and slightly faster CPU.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> motherboard compatibility
threads.message: Excellent. Thank you for your reply!
